superseding_details.unit_reference: The previously approved design proposals failed to provide direct access, with occupiers having to pass through the demise of the existing ground floor commercial space to access the flat.
superseding_details.component_description: This proposal features the creation of a private new front entrance door from pavement level on the Church Lane elevation of the building. This amendment shall provide better amenity use.

decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings titled:

GD2513/01 Existing & Elevations, GD2513/02 REV.B Proposed Plan & Elevations, GD2513/03 Location Plan, GD2513/04 Block Plan, GD2513/05 Existing Cross Sections, GD2513/06 Proposed Cross Sections, Flood Map, Air Quality Assessment, Economic Statement, Design and Access Statement

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
| No windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| The roof lights hereby approved shall be installed as conservation Conservation style rooflights and lie flush with the roof and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the conservation area in accordance with policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), policies 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Ealing Green Conservation Area Management Plan.
| Transport/commercial/industrial/cultural noise sources

Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of external noise levels from transport and industrial/ commercial/ cultural sources, having regard to the assessment standards of the Council's SPG10. Details shall include the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory tested including frames, seals and any integral ventilators, approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and details of self-noise) to achieve internal noise limits specified in SPG10. Best practicable mitigation measures shall also be implemented, as necessary, in external amenity spaces to achieve noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the units and neighbouring amenity in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| Separation of noise sensitive rooms from different uses in adjoining dwellings

Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, kitchen/living/dining room above/below bedroom of separate dwelling and bedrooms adjoining communal staircase. The assessment and mitigation measures shall have regard to standards of the Council's SPG10 and noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| Anti- vibration mounts and silencing of machinery etc.

Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| Cycle and bin

Cycle parking provision and refuse and recycling storage areas indicated on the approved plans and elevations shall be provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5, 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and policies T5 and SI8 The London Plan (2021).
| The front boundary treatment hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the development, and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the development is in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 7D of the Development Management, Development Plan Document; policies D3, D4 and D8 of the London Plan (2021); and National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| The shopfront features shall be retained in situ, except where indicated otherwise on the approved drawings, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason:

To safeguard the special architectural or historic interest, character, appearance and integrity of the Locally Listed building, and in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), D6,D8 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and Ealing Green Conservation Area Management Plan.
description: Change of use of first floor from an office (Use Class E) to a self-contained residential flat (Use Class C3); creation of a front entrance door; brick wall and hedging to the front forecourt; lightwells to front and rear, extending existing basement for ancillary use to office above
application_type_full: Full planning & demolition in a conservation area
